birth_place.zh-cn: 东京府赤坂区青山御所

death_place.zh-cn: 神奈川县三浦郡叶山町叶山御用邸
death_place.en: Hayama Imperial Villa, Hayama, Miura District, Kanagawa Prefecture

description.zh-cn: 日本第123代天皇，大日本帝国第2代大元帅。其在位期间年号为大正，见证了日本成为国际列强之一。
description.en: The 123rd Emperor of Japan and the 2nd Marshal-Admiral of the Empire of Japan. His reign, the Taishō period, saw Japan rise as a global power.

description.zh-cn: 日本第122代天皇，大正天皇的父亲。
description.en: The 122nd Emperor of Japan, father of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇的典侍，大正天皇的生母。
description.en: A concubine of Emperor Meiji and the biological mother of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇的皇后。
description.en: The Empress consort of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 日本第124代天皇，大正天皇的长子和继任者。
description.en: The 124th Emperor of Japan, the eldest son and successor of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 明治天皇的生母，负责养育年幼的大正天皇。
description.en: The biological mother of Emperor Meiji, she was responsible for raising the young Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇的次子。
description.en: The second son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇的三子。
description.en: The third son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇的幼子。
description.en: The fourth and youngest son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 日本政治家，曾任朝鲜统监，促成当时为皇太子的大正天皇访问韩国。
description.en: A Japanese statesman who served as the Resident-General of Korea and persuaded the then-Crown Prince Taishō to visit Korea.

description.zh-cn: 大韩帝国末代皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Korean Empire.

description.zh-cn: 日本首相，军阀巨头。其内阁因第一次护宪运动而下台，史称“大正政变”。
description.en: A Prime Minister of Japan and a military oligarch. His cabinet was forced to resign due to the first Movement to Protect the Constitution, an event known as the Taishō Political Crisis.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国初期领导人，北洋政府首脑。
description.en: An early leader of the Republic of China and the head of the Beiyang Government.

description.zh-cn: 1868年至1947年间日本的国号。
description.en: The official name of Japan from 1868 to 1947.

description.zh-cn: 日本一所为皇族和华族设立的教育机构。
description.en: A Japanese educational institution established for the Imperial Family and nobility.

description.zh-cn: 因君主年幼、患病或出国等原因，代行君主权力的职务。
description.en: An office held by a person appointed to administer the state because the monarch is a minor, is absent, or is incapacitated.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国宪法下授予天皇的最高军事头衔。
description.en: The highest military rank under the Constitution of the Empire of Japan, held by the Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 一场全球性战争，大正天皇在位期间日本作为协约国一方参战并获胜。
description.en: A global war in which Japan, under the reign of Emperor Taishō, participated on the side of the Allied Powers and emerged victorious.

description.zh-cn: 大正初期，由于民众抗议和民主运动，迫使桂太郎军阀内阁下台的政治事件。
description.en: A political event in the early Taishō period where popular protest and a pro-democracy movement forced the oligarchic cabinet of Katsura Tarō to resign.

description.zh-cn: 日本大正初期的政治运动，旨在反对军阀、维护宪政。
description.en: A political movement in early Taishō Japan aimed at opposing the oligarchs and protecting constitutional government.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇在位期间，日本出现的民主主义与自由主义思潮和政治运动。
description.en: A period of liberal and democratic thought and political movements in Japan during the reign of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 1915年日本向中华民国袁世凯政府提出的一系列不平等要求。
description.en: A set of unequal demands made in 1915 by Japan to the government of the Republic of China under Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 指1912年至1928年间，由北洋军阀所控制的中华民国北京政府。
description.en: Refers to the government of the Republic of China based in Beijing from 1912 to 1928, which was controlled by the Beiyang Clique.

en: Allied Powers of World War I

description.zh-cn: 第一次世界大战期间对抗同盟国的军事联盟。
description.en: The military alliance that fought against the Central Powers during World War I.

description.zh-cn: 由桂太郎领导的日本内阁。
description.en: The cabinet of Japan led by Katsura Tarō.

nodes.id: 台湾议会设置请愿运动

zh-cn: 台湾议会设置请愿运动
en: Petition Movement for the Establishment of a Taiwanese Parliament

description.zh-cn: 日治时期台湾人争取政治参与权的运动。
description.en: A movement by the Taiwanese people during the Japanese colonial period to demand political participation rights.

description.zh-cn: 1923年发生在日本关东地区的大地震，对东京、横滨等地造成毁灭性的破坏。
description.en: A major earthquake in the Kantō region of Japan in 1923, which caused devastating damage to Tokyo, Yokohama, and surrounding areas.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇是明治天皇的儿子。
description.en: Emperor Taishō was the son of Emperor Meiji.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇是柳原爱子的儿子。
description.en: Emperor Taishō was the son of Yanagihara Naruko.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇于1900年5月10日与九条节子（后来的贞明皇后）结婚。
description.en: Emperor Taishō married Kujō Sadako (later Empress Teimei) on May 10, 1900.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇由其祖母中山庆子（明治天皇的生母）负责养育。
description.en: Emperor Taishō was raised by his grandmother, Nakayama Yoshiko (the biological mother of Emperor Meiji).

description.zh-cn: 昭和天皇是大正天皇的长子。
description.en: Emperor Shōwa was the eldest son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 秩父宫雍仁亲王是大正天皇的次子。
description.en: Prince Chichibu was the second son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 高松宫宣仁亲王是大正天皇的三子。
description.en: Prince Takamatsu was the third son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 三笠宫崇仁亲王是大正天皇的幼子。
description.en: Prince Mikasa was the youngest son of Emperor Taishō.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇曾就读于学习院但中途退学。
description.en: Emperor Taishō attended the Gakushūin but dropped out.

description.zh-cn: 嘉仁于1912年7月30日继位为大正天皇。
description.en: Yoshihito succeeded to the throne as Emperor Taishō on July 30, 1912.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇在位期间担任帝国大元帅。
description.en: Emperor Taishō held the rank of Marshal-Admiral during his reign.

description.zh-cn: 因大正天皇健康状况不佳，皇太子裕仁于1921年开始摄政。
description.en: Due to Emperor Taishō's poor health, Crown Prince Hirohito was appointed Regent in 1921.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇驾崩后，皇太子裕仁继位成为昭和天皇。
description.en: After the death of Emperor Taishō, Crown Prince Hirohito succeeded him as Emperor Shōwa.

description.zh-cn: 1907年，朝鲜统监伊藤博文说服当时为皇太子的嘉仁访问韩国。
description.en: In 1907, Resident-General of Korea Itō Hirobumi persuaded then-Crown Prince Yoshihito to visit Korea.

description.zh-cn: 1907年，皇太子嘉仁访问韩国，受到皇帝纯宗的迎接。
description.en: In 1907, Crown Prince Yoshihito visited Korea and was received by Emperor Sunjong.

description.zh-cn: 第一次护宪运动引发了普遍的抗议风潮，迫使桂太郎内阁下台。
description.en: The first Movement to Protect the Constitution sparked widespread protests, forcing the Katsura Cabinet to resign.

description.zh-cn: 在大正政变中，大正天皇出面干涉，表达了希望维持政局稳定的意愿，桂太郎内阁因此下台。
description.en: During the Taishō Political Crisis, Emperor Taishō intervened to express his desire for political stability, leading to the resignation of the Katsura Cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 在第一次世界大战期间，大正天皇领导下的日本加入协约国参战。
description.en: During World War I, Japan, led by Emperor Taishō, joined the Allied Powers.

description.zh-cn: 大正天皇在位期间，日本逼迫袁世凯领导的中国北洋政府签署“二十一条”及“中日民四条约”。
description.en: During Emperor Taishō's reign, Japan forced the Beiyang Government of China, led by Yuan Shikai, to sign the 'Twenty-One Demands' and the 'Sino-Japanese Treaty of 1915'.

description.zh-cn: 以第一次护宪运动为起点，要求政党政治的民主运动最终促成了“大正民主”的实现。
description.en: Starting with the first Movement to Protect the Constitution, the pro-democracy movement demanding party politics ultimately led to the realization of 'Taishō democracy'.

relationships.target: 台湾议会设置请愿运动

description.zh-cn: “大正民主”时期的民主化浪潮影响到当时的日属台湾，促使林献堂等人发起台湾议会设置请愿运动。
description.en: The wave of democratization during the 'Taishō democracy' period influenced then-Japanese-ruled Taiwan, prompting figures like Lin Hsien-tang to initiate the Petition Movement for the Establishment of a Taiwanese Parliament.

description.zh-cn: 关东大地震是发生在大正天皇统治后期的重大灾难，加深了其“不幸的大正”的公众印象。
description.en: The Great Kantō earthquake was a major disaster during the later part of Emperor Taishō's reign, contributing to his public image as the 'unfortunate Taishō'.
